t: Revelation 3
To the Church in Sardis

“And*rp to*r the*r angel*r of*r the*r church*r in*r Sardis*r write:*r ‘The*r words*r of*r him*r who*r has*r the*r seven*r spirits*r of*r God*r and*r the*r seven*r stars.*r “‘I*rp know*r your*r works.*r You*r have*r the*r reputation*r of*r being*r alive,*r but*r you*r are*r dead.*r
Wake*r up,*r and*r strengthen*r what*r remains*r and*r is*r about*r to*r die,*r for*r I*r have*r not*r found*r your*r works*r complete*r in*r the*r sight*r of*r my*r God.*r

Remember,*r then,*r what*r you*r received*r and*r heard.*r Keep*r it,*r and*r repent.*r If*r you*r will*r not*r wake*r up,*r I*r will*r come*r like*r a*r thief,*r and*r you*r will*r not*r know*r at*r what*r hour*r I*r will*r come*r against*r you.*r
Yet*r you*r have*r still*r a*r few*r names*r in*r Sardis,*r people*r who*r have*r not*r soiled*r their*r garments,*r and*r they*r will*r walk*r with*r me*r in*r white,*r for*r they*r are*r worthy.*r

The*r one*r who*r conquers*r will*r be*r clothed*r thus*r in*r white*r garments,*r and*r I*r will*r never*r blot*r his*r name*r out*r of*r the*r book*r of*r life.*r I*r will*r confess*r his*r name*r before*r my*r Father*r and*r before*r his*r angels.*r
He*r who*r has*r an*r ear,*r let*r him*r hear*r what*r the*r Spirit*r says*r to*r the*r churches.’*r
To the Church in Philadelphia

“And*rp to*r the*r angel*r of*r the*r church*r in*r Philadelphia*r write:*r ‘The*r words*r of*r the*r holy*r one,*r the*r true*r one,*r who*r has*r the*r key*r of*r David,*r who*r opens*r and*r no*r one*r will*r shut,*r who*r shuts*r and*r no*r one*r opens.*r

“‘I*rp know*r your*r works.*r Behold,*r I*r have*r set*r before*r you*r an*r open*r door,*r which*r no*r one*r is*r able*r to*r shut.*r I*r know*r that*r you*r have*r but*r little*r power,*r and*r yet*r you*r have*r kept*r my*r word*r and*r have*r not*r denied*r my*r name.*r

Behold,*r I*r will*r make*r those*r of*r the*r synagogue*r of*r Satan*r who*r say*r that*r they*r are*r Jews*r and*r are*r not,*r but*r lie—*r behold,*r I*r will*r make*r them*r come*r and*r bow*r down*r before*r your*r feet,*r and*r they*r will*r learn*r that*r I*r have*r loved*r you.*r

Because*r you*r have*r kept*r my*r word*r about*r patient*r endurance,*r I*r will*r keep*r you*r from*r the*r hour*r of*r trial*r that*r is*r coming*r on*r the*r whole*r world,*r to*r try*r those*r who*r dwell*r on*r the*r earth.*r
I*r am*r coming*r soon.*r Hold*r fast*r what*r you*r have,*r so*r that*r no*r one*r may*r seize*r your*r crown.*r

The*r one*r who*r conquers,*r I*r will*r make*r him*r a*r pillar*r in*r the*r temple*r of*r my*r God.*r Never*r shall*r he*r go*r out*r of*r it,*r and*r I*r will*r write*r on*r him*r the*r name*r of*r my*r God,*r and*r the*r name*r of*r the*r city*r of*r my*r God,*r the*r new*r Jerusalem,*r which*r comes*r down*r from*r my*r God*r out*r of*r heaven,*r and*r my*r own*r new*r name.*r
He*r who*r has*r an*r ear,*r let*r him*r hear*r what*r the*r Spirit*r says*r to*r the*r churches.’*r
To the Church in Laodicea
“And*rp to*r the*r angel*r of*r the*r church*r in*r Laodicea*r write:*r ‘The*r words*r of*r the*r Amen,*r the*r faithful*r and*r true*r witness,*r the*r beginning*r of*r God’s*r creation.*r
“‘I*rp know*r your*r works:*r you*r are*r neither*r cold*r nor*r hot.*r Would*r that*r you*r were*r either*r cold*r or*r hot!*r
So,*r because*r you*r are*r lukewarm,*r and*r neither*r hot*r nor*r cold,*r I*r will*r spit*r you*r out*r of*r my*r mouth.*r
For*r you*r say,*r I*r am*r rich,*r I*r have*r prospered,*r and*r I*r need*r nothing,*r not*r realizing*r that*r you*r are*r wretched,*r pitiable,*r poor,*r blind,*r and*r naked.*r

I*r counsel*r you*r to*r buy*r from*r me*r gold*r refined*r by*r fire,*r so*r that*r you*r may*r be*r rich,*r and*r white*r garments*r so*r that*r you*r may*r clothe*r yourself*r and*r the*r shame*r of*r your*r nakedness*r may*r not*r be*r seen,*r and*r salve*r to*r anoint*r your*r eyes,*r so*r that*r you*r may*r see.*r
Those*r whom*r I*r love,*r I*r reprove*r and*r discipline,*r so*r be*r zealous*r and*r repent.*r

Behold,*r I*r stand*r at*r the*r door*r and*r knock.*r If*r anyone*r hears*r my*r voice*r and*r opens*r the*r door,*r I*r will*r come*r in*r to*r him*r and*r eat*r with*r him,*r and*r he*r with*r me.*r
The*r one*r who*r conquers,*r I*r will*r grant*r him*r to*r sit*r with*r me*r on*r my*r throne,*r as*r I*r also*r conquered*r and*r sat*r down*r with*r my*r Father*r on*r his*r throne.*r
He*r who*r has*r an*r ear,*r let*r him*r hear*r what*r the*r Spirit*r says*r to*r the*r churches.’”*r
